channel.title: BBC News - England
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Bernadette Walker: Stepdad jailed for murdering teen over abuse claim
item.description: Scott Walker is jailed for at least 32 years for killing Bernadette Walker, who has never been found.

item.title: Dewsbury fire: Dozens of firefighters tackle blaze
item.description: The blaze broke out in the Savile Town area of Dewsbury on Friday afternoon, fire crews say.

item.title: M1: Arrest warrant for mum accused of killing kids in crash
item.description: Mary McCann misses a court date where she was due to answer charges following a crash on the M1.

item.title: MP Nigel Adams filmed swearing at Mr Stop Brexit Steve Bray
item.description: Nigel Adams defends his response to campaigner Steve Bray accusing him of harassing politicians.

item.title: West Midlands Police apologises for failing domestic abuse victim
item.description: Suzanne Van Hagen's family say they have fought for more than eight years to get the truth.

item.title: Imran Ahmad Khan: Wakefield MP denies sexual assault on boy
item.description: Imran Ahmad Khan appears at the Old Bailey to deny the offence alleged to have happened in 2008.

item.title: Clarkson's Farm: 'Swamped' village has seen more trade
item.description: Jeremy Clarkson said businesses in Chadlington were "doing better" due to an influx of visitors.

item.title: Actor Sir Antony Sher diagnosed with terminal illness
item.description: He is widely regarded as one of country's finest contemporary classical actors.

item.title: Cornwall hospitals suspend surgeries due to pressures
item.description: Bosses made the "difficult decision" because of issues including treating more Covid-19 patients.

item.title: Clacton grandad left to die near his GP surgery, family say
item.description: Brian Fenn collapses near his GP surgery and dies after an ambulance takes 47 minutes to arrive.

item.title: Bugzy Malone punched men in self-defence amid break-in fears, court told
item.description: The rapper says he received two calls about a raid at his home on the night of the alleged assault.

item.title: Lucy-Anne Rushton murder detective jailed for witness signature forgery
item.description: The former officer signed a witness's name on a statement during an inquiry into a woman's murder.

item.title: Wallace and Gromit: Creator Nick Park unveils comedy duo's Preston statue
item.description: Oscar-winning animator Nick Park says he is "gobsmacked" how well the statue has turned out.

item.title: Rio Ferdinand: 'I have to explain the monkey emoji to my kids'
item.description: Former England footballer Rio Ferdinand tells MPs about his experience of online hate and racism.

item.title: Blackpool sailor gets medal for LGBT maritime diversity work
item.description: Paul Owen is the first recipient of the Merchant Navy Medal for LGBT+ work in the maritime sector.

item.title: The rapper giving away school uniforms to kids on free school meals
item.description: Inspired by Marcus Rashford, Jords has donated over 100 blazers to children on free school meals.

item.title: Leicestershire sisters on track for Olympic glory
item.description: Indienne and Shaikira have both recently been crowned national champions.

item.title: 9/11: 'All we could see was smoke in the distance'
item.description: A couple reflect on how close they came to being caught up in the devastation of the 9/11 attacks.

item.title: Cressida Dick: Met commissioner given two-year contract extension
item.description: Dame Cressida Dick has come under fire from victims of police injustice who called for her to go.

item.title: Declan Jones: Assault PC jailed for six months
item.description: The former West Midlands PC attacked a man, then kicked and punched a 15-year-old boy.

item.title: Bristol petrol station siege: Stabbed man in serious condition
item.description: Armed officers arrested a 52-year-old man after a two-hour stand-off at the Bristol petrol station.

item.title: Benjamin Mendy: Manchester City footballer in court on rape charges
item.description: The Premier League footballer is accused of attacking three women at his home in Cheshire.

item.title: Coventry MP Zarah Sultana recounts 'Islamophobic hate'
item.description: The Labour member breaks down in tears as she recalls being treated as an "enemy of the country".

item.title: Barbados to Rotherham: Lizard's 4,000-mile trip hidden in bra
item.description: A Rotherham woman finds she has brought more home from the Caribbean than just a tan.

item.title: Brierley Hill murders: Killer jailed over Range Rover shooting
item.description: Jonathan Houseman is jailed for life over the "executions" of Will Henry and Brian McIntosh.

item.title: US Open: Emma Raducanu says reaching final is 'crazy, cool and absolutely mind-blowing'
item.description: British teenager Emma Raducanu says reaching her first Grand Slam final at the US Open feels "crazy, cool and absolutely mind-blowing".

item.title: Was it right to cancel the fifth Test? And what happens now?
item.description: After the England-India series finale is called off, BBC Sport asks whether the Indian Premier League is to blame and what it means for the Ashes.

item.title: Man Utd players have 'no place to hide' since Ronaldo arrival - Solskjaer
item.description: Manchester United boss Ole Gunnar Solskjaer says there is "no place to hide" for his players following the return of Cristiano Ronaldo.

item.title: Keely Hodgkinson: GB teenager wins Diamond League 800m title to cap extraordinary year
item.description: British teenager Keely Hodgkinson wins the Diamond League 800m title to bank $30,000 in prize money and cap an extraordinary year.
